sentences.english: But God has seen my hardship and the toil of my hands, and last night he rebuked you.
sentences.chinese: 上帝看见我的苦情和我的劳碌，就在昨夜责备你。

sentences.english: I poured out my complaint before him; I shewed before him my trouble.
sentences.chinese: 我在他面前吐露我的苦情，陈说我的患难。

sentences.english: The employees were asked to detail their complains and grievances.
sentences.chinese: 要求雇员们逐一说明他们的怨言和苦情。

sentences.english: But nobody cares about their grievances, " I said."
sentences.chinese: “但是没有人关心他们的苦情，”我说。

sentences.english: I am full of confusion; therefore see thou mine affliction;
sentences.chinese: 正是满心羞愧，眼见我的苦情。

sentences.english: God hath seen mine affliction and the labour of my hands, and rebuked thee yesternight.
sentences.chinese: 上帝看见我的苦情和我的劳碌，就在昨夜责备你。

sentences.english: Bitter drama of this kind influences oriental dramas.
sentences.chinese: 这种苦情剧对整个东方戏剧都有影响。

sentences.english: And God looked upon the children of Israel, and God had respect unto them.
sentences.chinese: 神看顾以色列人，也知道他们的苦情。

sentences.english: I pour out my complaint before him; before him I tell my trouble.
sentences.chinese: 我在他面前吐露我的苦情，陈说我的患难。

sentences.english: The trade union leader spoke about the grievances of the workers.
sentences.chinese: 工会领袖述说工人们的苦情。

definition: great bitterness, deep hatred (idiom); deeply ingrained long-standing resentment
to stir up emotion/to arouse sympathy/moving
the design of a character (in games, manga etc) (abbr. for 人物設定|人物设定)/(fig.) (a celebrity or other public figure's) image in the eyes of the public/public persona
idol drama/drama series in which the actors are chosen for their preexisting popularity with young viewers
to move to tears (of a story)/tear-provoking (gas)/lacrimogen
